page.title: 14Social Concerns-Old Folk
page.content: Thistleberry House,Newcastle,Staffs was built in 1961 for people over the age of 65, who were not capable of living alone.A matron and a total of 36 full and part time staff look after them. The majority of the inhabitants have lived in Newcastle for most of their lives.Each of them has their own room but all meals are cooked for them.They eat a good,varied diet including breakfast,a hot meal and sandwiches each day. Personal pets are not allowed,but the home has some fish and a budgerigar.The old people may go on weekly day trips to local places.Some are lucky enough to take longer holidays with family or friends.They spend their time talking, listening to the radio or watching T.V. Some knit or play cards and dominoes. All of them noticed changes in fashion, local shops and new houses.
